overview:
At the age of 11, Adam had already started his entrepreneurial journey. He developed and sold a customized PSP (Playstation Portable) software on eBay that enabled the device to play open-source free games. After selling a couple hundred units over a summer, Adam was inspired to continue his entrepreneurial activities.

A few years later Adam made a similar open source software for the iPhone and started selling iPhones in bulk both on eBay and Craigslist. But he still wasn’t satisfied despite having six figures in the bank. He wanted to create something unique that he could call his own.

Enter Swapidy.

Being an avid eBay seller for several years, Adam realized the amount of money he lost in fees was quite substantial. Not only do sites like eBay charge a hefty fee for selling an item - there’s a second charge for transmitting the payment via Paypal. On top of that, add shipping costs. Finally, the value of a product depreciates by 15-20 percent when you sell secondhand online.

Instead of buying and selling on eBay in pursuit of saving on fees, Adam turned to local classifieds such as Craigslist. Although Craigslist is a great option for local commerce, it certainly isn’t the safest or the most reliable. Adam found that many times, he’d have to drive hours to supposedly get an amazing deal to find out when he got there, the person was a no show or a weirdo.

Consequently, Adam created his vision of an online trading hub free from the problems of eBay or Craigslist. “I wanted a place where I could not only get amazing deals like you can on Craigslist, but where I could have a seamless experience similar to eBay with lower fees.”
